column5: I was so excited for this opener.  I have been trying to catch a muskie for the last 3 years now.  Left Kitchener at 3am saturday mornin.  Met up with Sinker at his place at 5am and off we went to his secret spot.  Sinker is a great guy, and he's a newfie just like me.   He said we would see some muskie that day and he didn't lie.  We had several follows.  I almost poop my pants when a respectable fish followed my lure.  We fished hard in the scorching sun and only breaked for a quick bite to eat.  We did manage to boat one ski and several nice eyes.  Hope you enjoy the pics. This would not have been possible without Sinker's help.  He's the best.  I can't wait to go fishing with him again.  Maybe you should charge me next time.  He is a musky hunter and thanks to you so am I.  Enjoy
Congrats, now kiss your fishing budget goodbye, those skis are addicting!
Nice fish. Way to go!
Great report, pics, and fish!!!
awesome. hopefully i'll get one this season too!

Lucky son of a b...... LOL  My mission for the day was to get you your first.  Mission accomplished.  It took 12 hours on the water  , under scorching sun  , non stop casting and a couple short trolls between spots.  PD is a trooper..  ...most people would have given up long before we did. Even I had a couple little "rests" during the day......PD kept on going. He even went swimming to get back a snagged lure.....I should have taken a pic. It was hilarious!!  Anyways, your welcome back anytime man. The pleasure was all mine. I'd go out musky hunting with you anytime. Its hard to find someone who can put in a whole day on the water, in those conditions, and still want more.  Congrats on the first of many.......just too bad I couldn't catch a dam thing!!!  We'll do it again for sure....  Sinker
Nice going! Thats a fine looking fish ehg

hey way to go on the first ski...I know I loved it when I broke that skunk for the first time.  mission accomplished there...hunting muskies can be pretty tough sometimes,nothin like spending so much time on the water in the boat for the day that ya still feel like you are getting tossed up and down for an hour after ya get back on land eh guys  gonna get fishin elbow from tossing so many big lures around all day....guess that's a bit more pleasant of an affliction than....golf balls
Sweeeet.  That must have been a great day.   Beauty 'ski and quite the mission accomplished!  cheers HD
Congrats on your first musky! Just gotta love the colors on these fish ... WTG!
Congrats, good stuff...
Very nice fish, way to go!
Awesome report and congrats on a great first muskie!!  Sinker is a class act....he took Bly and I out the weekend before and put us on fish...he sure knows his spots and techniques that's for sure!
Congrats on your first ski, I was hoping to run into you guys on the lake, maybe next time.
Great looking fish and Congrats on your first muskie.
Congrats. Was a great day. I should have went with you guys, my luck was not to be on Saturday. I am going fishin for the First week of July hopefully the weeds and the bite are on.  Great job guys.
Fantastic  Congrats on the first 'ski.  At $10-20 a lure, I'd go for a dip on a hot day.lol
Great job boys, nice report.  Congrats on the first one too, good luck with many more this year.
thanks for sharing.
Nice musky! I too am looking to get one this year.
congrats on getting that first one, sounds like you both had a great day.

Great report. Looks like you got into a bunch of pickerel and a nice Muskie. Your Poker face was doing well until you hooked the pickerel on the musky lure, and when you caught the Musky.lol  Oh and nice shirt(I am Canadian). I used to get most of my wardrobe from 24's of Canadian! Now they got cheap. So I have no more shirts to wear.lol

Haha.....thats my lucky musky shirt. I have a bunch of pics of me with musky, while wearing that shirt. I figured I might as well wear it on the first day.....didnt' work though....LOL. Dammit....  Sinker
